item_what_happened: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent unveiled a $20 billion bailout for Argentina that funnels benefits to billionaire Rob Citrone, his longtime associate, who had recently boosted his bond holdings. Citrone, who previously enriched Bessent, made the bet just before CPAC-linked lobbyists, paid by Argentina, helped secure the deal.
item_why_it_matters: Trump is pushing the U.S. toward a shutdown, the economy is deteriorating, and farmers are on the verge of bankruptcy‚Äîyet his regime is bailing out Argentina‚Äôs economy. This ridiculous deal is about enriching Trump‚Äôs cronies while abandoning Americans at home.
title: Trump‚Äôs Argentina Bailout Enriches One Well-Connected US Billionaire
authors: Judd Legum, Dan Friedman, Hannah Levintova, Rebecca Crosby, Noel Sims, Pema Levy, Julia M√©traux, Keerti Gopal, Jackie Flynn Mogensen, Henry Carnell

item_what_happened: YouTube agreed to pay Trump $24.5 million to settle his lawsuit over the suspension of his account after January 6. Of that, $22 million will fund Trump‚Äôs planned White House ballroom, with the rest going to allied plaintiffs like the American Conservative Union.
item_why_it_matters: The settlement turns a ‚Äúfree-speech‚Äù fight into a cash pipeline for Trump‚Äôs vanity projects. By steering corporate payouts into his ballroom, he‚Äôs blurring public office and private gain, converting legal battles into revenue streams for his empire.
title: YouTube to pay $22 million for White House ballroom to settle lawsuit from Trump
authors: Jacob, Justice Department Reporter, Jake Rosen Is A Reporter Covering The Department Of Justice. He Was Previously A Campaign Digital Reporter Covering President Trump'S Campaign, Also Served As An Associate Producer For, Face The Nation With Margaret Brennan., Read Full Bio, Arden, Jennifer

item_what_happened: Russell Vought, Trump‚Äôs budget chief, is driving a plan to expand presidential power by gutting agencies, canceling spending, and seizing control of independent regulators. After sidelining Elon Musk‚Äôs unauthorized DOGE, Vought has set up legal fights to allow Trump to override Congress‚Äôs power of the purse.
item_why_it_matters: Vought is enforcing Project 2025, an authoritarian plan to shred checks and balances. He‚Äôs gutting agencies, purging civil servants, and locking in Trump‚Äôs control‚Äîturning the U.S. government into a weapon of Trump‚Äôs rule.
title: nytimes.com

item_what_happened: Trump‚Äôs demand for James Comey‚Äôs indictment set a precedent of prosecuting political foes, with Kash Patel and others weaponizing institutions against perceived enemies. Even Republicans warn this ‚Äúretribution campaign‚Äù could boomerang, normalizing cycles of partisan revenge once Democrats regain power.
item_why_it_matters: Trump is weaponizing government to crush his opponents and carry out his retribution, and this is only the beginning. Our taxpayer-funded agencies are being turned into his personal enforcers, following the same authoritarian playbook Putin used to erase dissent and cement power.
title: nytimes.com

item_what_happened: Internal DOE memos show Trump officials weighing a plan to divert plutonium, including from nuclear warhead ‚Äúpits,‚Äù into civilian reactors. Watchdogs and lawmakers warn that the move undermines U.S. arsenal readiness, boosts proliferation risks, and reeks of conflicts of interest with firms like Oklo.
item_why_it_matters: Using weapons-grade plutonium for power blurs the line between defense stockpiles and industry supply chains. It weakens nuclear deterrence and fuels global risks‚Äîall to prop up an unproven reactor market and meet AI‚Äôs surging energy demand.
title: Just a moment...

item_what_happened: Pete Hegseth federalized 200 Oregon National Guard troops after Trump ordered deployments to Portland to ‚Äúprotect‚Äù an ICE facility. Oregon‚Äôs attorney general immediately sued Trump, Hegseth, and Kristi Noem, blasting the move as unconstitutional and rooted in false claims of ‚Äúdomestic terrorists.‚Äù
item_why_it_matters: Trump is expanding a police state by normalizing military occupations of Democratic-led cities. Oregon‚Äôs lawsuit will test whether courts can rein in his push to override state authority and use federal troops for political control.
title: reuters.com

item_what_happened: The Justice Department has opened a national security probe into FBI leadership under Christopher Wray over alleged ‚Äúmishandling‚Äù of documents tied to the Durham investigation. Prosecutors in Virginia are questioning senior FBI staff and reviewing classified records in ‚Äúburn bags,‚Äù following Trump‚Äôs calls for more indictments after James Comey‚Äôs prosecution.
item_why_it_matters: This escalates Trump‚Äôs purge of FBI leaders, weaponizing the DOJ to criminalize perceived enemies. By targeting Wray, his own appointee, Trump shows that no one is safe, shredding the independence of U.S. law enforcement and tightening his authoritarian grip.
title: Trump‚Äôs DOJ probes former FBI leadership over document mishandling allegations

item_what_happened: The Government Accountability Office ruled FEMA illegally withheld funds for homeless aid, migrant services, and emergency warning systems. GAO said the move violated the Impoundment Control Act, which restricts presidents from blocking congressionally approved spending.
item_why_it_matters: Echoing Trump‚Äôs Ukraine aid freeze, the ruling shows a pattern of abusing budget powers for political aims. By unlawfully blocking disaster and shelter funds, Trump undermines Congress‚Äôs authority and leaves vulnerable communities without critical support.
title: Access to this page has been denied

item_what_happened: Trump said George Soros was a ‚Äúlikely candidate‚Äù for prosecution, escalating his crackdown on liberal groups after activist Charlie Kirk‚Äôs killing. Soros‚Äô Open Society Foundations called it a political attack, echoing Hungary‚Äôs Viktor Orb√°n, who forced the group out of the country.
item_why_it_matters: Targeting Soros and OSF expands Trump‚Äôs weaponized DOJ from political rivals to civil society. By branding nonprofits as ‚Äúterrorism,‚Äù he is normalizing authoritarian tactics to criminalize dissent and erode democracy.
title: 'We're not afraid': George Soros' foundation on being Trump's next target

item_what_happened: An ICE officer filmed assaulting a woman to the floor outside New York‚Äôs immigration court has been reinstated just days after DHS called his behavior ‚Äúunacceptable.‚Äù The video, showing officers tearing apart a family, triggered outrage and demands for prosecution from New York officials.
item_why_it_matters: The reversal underscores Trump‚Äôs embrace of abusive enforcement tactics and disregard for accountability. By restoring the officer, he reiterates that brutality is not only tolerated but rewarded.
title: ICE officer seen on video pushing woman to ground has returned to duty
authors: Camilo, Immigration Reporter, Camilo Montoya-Galvez Is The Immigration Reporter At Cbs News. Based In Washington, He Covers Immigration Policy, Read Full Bio

item_what_happened: Federal agents in camouflage detained Jaime Ramirez, his wife Noemi Chavez, and their two children at Chicago‚Äôs Millennium Park without showing a warrant, disappearing them into a Border Patrol vehicle as bystanders filmed. Chavez says she was pressured to sign a voluntary departure order, refused, and was still told she and her children would be deported to Guatemala‚Äîdespite a lack of legal justification. Her husband remains held separately as DHS‚Äôs ‚ÄúOperation at Large‚Äù swept up multiple families across Chicago.
item_why_it_matters: Federal agents continue openly bypassing due process, using militarized raids in public spaces to target families with young children. Disappearing people without legal authority shreds constitutional protections.
title: Mother, children detained by ICE at Millennium Park Sunday held at O‚ÄôHare with other families: ‚ÄòWe never imagined‚Äô

item_what_happened: Masked Border Patrol agents in camouflage marched through downtown Chicago, detaining people in public based partly on ‚Äúhow they look,‚Äù Commander Gregory Bovino admitted. The armed patrols‚Äîpassing Millennium Park and Trump Tower‚Äîwere part of Trump‚Äôs ‚ÄúOperation At Large,‚Äù greenlit by a Supreme Court ruling that permits stops based on race and language.
item_why_it_matters: This is racial profiling on steroids‚Äîfederal agents targeting people by appearance in the heart of U.S. cities. Trump is using militarized roundups to erode constitutional protections and stage intimidation spectacles.
title: Feds march into Downtown Chicago; top border agent says people are arrested based partly on ‚Äòhow they look‚Äô
authors: Chip Mitchell, Ashlee Rezin, Kaitlin Washburn, Mary Norkol, Jon Seidel

item_what_happened: The Justice Department filed a civil suit against pro-Palestinian groups in New Jersey, accusing them of intimidating Jewish worshippers at a synagogue protest. In a first-of-its-kind move, the DOJ invoked the FACE Act‚Äîa law typically used to protect abortion clinics‚Äîto target demonstrators.
item_why_it_matters: The case highlights how Trump‚Äôs DOJ is weaponizing civil rights law selectively‚Äîcurtailing its use against anti-abortion activists while expanding it against pro-Palestinian groups. It marks another step in criminalizing dissent.
title: reuters.com

item_what_happened: Two HUD attorneys, Palmer Heenan and Paul Osadebe, were dismissed after exposing Trump officials‚Äô efforts to stall or kill Fair Housing Act enforcement. Internal memos show civil rights work was deemed ‚Äúnot a priority,‚Äù blocking thousands of discrimination cases against landlords, lenders, and realtors.
item_why_it_matters: Trump‚Äôs purge of whistleblowers and civil rights lawyers guts a cornerstone of U.S. anti-discrimination protections. By silencing those tasked with enforcing housing rights, he‚Äôs dismantling safeguards and consolidating power through fear.
title: nytimes.com

item_what_happened: ICE disappears dozens of West Africans to Ghana despite court rulings blocking their removal, after which Ghana expelled some into Togo without documents. Deportees include political dissidents and LGBTQ people now stranded and in hiding.
item_why_it_matters: Trump is defying U.S. courts and international law, weaponizing disappearances as collective punishment. Vulnerable people are being dumped into danger, shredding due process and basic human rights.
title: West Africans deported from US to Ghana ‚Äòdumped without documents in Togo‚Äô

item_what_happened: Trump officials moved to exclude Harvard University from all federal contracts and funding, accusing the school of ‚Äúdeliberate indifference‚Äù to campus antisemitism. If upheld, Harvard would lose billions in research dollars, and its students would be barred from federal loans, aid, and fellowships.
item_why_it_matters: This is the most extreme escalation yet in Trump‚Äôs war on elite universities, effectively threatening Harvard with financial annihilation. It‚Äôs part of a broader campaign to weaponize federal funding against institutions seen as ideological enemies.
title: Are you a robot?

item_what_happened: Top U.S. generals, including Joint Chiefs Chairman Gen. Dan Caine, are sounding alarms over Pete Hegseth‚Äôs strategy that shifts the Pentagon‚Äôs focus to homeland crackdowns. The plan cuts forces in Europe and Africa while prioritizing border deployments and domestic operations over countering China.
item_why_it_matters: The strategy politicizes the military and weakens alliances, sidelining China as a threat. By tying defense to Trump‚Äôs domestic agenda and purging generals, Hegseth is turning the Pentagon into a partisan weapon‚Äîas Trump launches a war on the American people.

item_what_happened: Draft HUD rules obtained by ProPublica reveal Trump officials planning work requirements, two-year limits, and strict immigration checks on federal housing aid. Families with even one undocumented member would lose assistance, putting millions at risk of eviction and homelessness.
item_why_it_matters: This is a direct assault on the housing safety net amid record rents and homelessness. Framed as ‚Äúself-sufficiency,‚Äù the plan will uproot children, destabilize families, and leave millions without shelter.
title: Millions Could Lose Housing Aid Under Trump Plan
authors: Jesse Coburn, I Welcome Tips Anyone, Especially Government Officials, About Wrongdoing Or Injustice In The Fields Of Housing, .Wp-Block-Propublica-Byline Font-Size Var, Media Min-Width

item_what_happened: Federal drug prosecutions in 2025 fell to their lowest level in decades as Trump redirected prosecutors and agents to immigration enforcement. Conspiracy and money-laundering cases against cartel leaders have stalled, and the DOJ‚Äôs top anti-cartel task force is being dismantled.
item_why_it_matters: Trump vowed a drug war but gutted real investigations to feed his deportation machine. The pivot leaves fentanyl pipelines unchecked, cripples cartel cases, and turns federal law enforcement into little more than political theater.
title: reuters.com

item_what_happened: Months after a mile-wide tornado leveled parts of St. Louis, FEMA aid remains frozen as Trump‚Äôs downsizing agenda cripples recovery. Staff exits, bureaucratic logjams, and diversion of FEMA resources to ICE have left debris uncleared and schools shuttered, forcing residents to organize their own relief.
item_why_it_matters: By hollowing out FEMA, Trump is dismantling disaster response and leaving states to fend for themselves. Communities from Missouri to Texas are paying the price now, with future hurricanes, floods, and wildfires poised to unleash even greater chaos.
title: wsj.com

item_what_happened: North Carolina ended its Medicaid ‚ÄúHealthy Opportunities Pilot,‚Äù which provided food, housing, and transportation aid to vulnerable residents. The program, shown to improve health and cut hospital costs, was cut after Trump‚Äôs Medicaid reductions, and state Republican lawmakers declined to renew funding.
item_why_it_matters: Thousands of struggling families are now left without fresh food or safe housing in a region still reeling from Hurricane Helene. The shutdown shows how Trump‚Äôs cuts to social safety nets are stripping away lifelines for the poor, leaving long-term health and economic fallout.
title: nytimes.com

item_what_happened: Trump will open 13 million acres of federal land for coal mining and direct $625 million to revive or modernize coal plants. The plan slashes royalties and mandates keeping fossil-fuel facilities online despite scheduled retirements.
item_why_it_matters: Trump continues reversing clean-energy gains and subsidizing the dirtiest fuel in America. The policy locks in decades of pollution, sidelines cheaper renewables, and props up a dying industry to serve his fossil-fuel agenda and donors.
title: Trump administration opens more land for coal mining, offers $625M to boost coal-fired power plants
authors: Daly Covers Climate, Environment, Energy Policy For The Associated Press. He Is Based In Washington

item_what_happened: West Virginia, where coal generates 86% of electricity, is seeing utility bills rise nearly twice the national average. Almost one in five households is behind on payments, with disconnections surging as Trump‚Äôs policies force coal plants to stay open while blocking cheaper wind and solar projects.
item_why_it_matters: Trump‚Äôs coal-first agenda is driving residents in America‚Äôs coal capital into energy poverty, with families paying rent-sized energy bills. The state‚Äôs reliance on costly, aging coal plants shows how fossil-fuel dependency locks consumers into decades of higher prices while cleaner, cheaper alternatives are sidelined.
title: nytimes.com

item_what_happened: Trump‚Äôs 2026 budget and House Republicans propose nearly $2 billion in cuts to HIV prevention and treatment, including eliminating the CDC‚Äôs HIV-prevention division and slashing NIH research grants. Experts warn these cuts could drive 200,000 new HIV cases by 2030, undermining years of bipartisan progress.
item_why_it_matters: The U.S. has the tools to end the HIV epidemic, with breakthroughs like long-acting PrEP, but gutting prevention and treatment programs will reverse hard-won gains. The cuts reflect Trump‚Äôs broader push to dismantle public health funding while prioritizing tax breaks for the wealthy.

item_what_happened: The Transportation Department will no longer enforce Biden-era rules requiring airlines to reimburse passengers for damages and extra costs when wheelchairs are mishandled. The protections, opposed by major airlines, were designed to address widespread problems for disabled travelers.
item_why_it_matters: Trump‚Äôs rollback leaves millions of disabled passengers vulnerable to abuse, gutting accountability for airlines that damage or lose mobility devices. By siding with corporate interests, the regime is stripping away basic rights and dignity in air travel.
title: reuters.com

item_what_happened: Stephen Miller, Trump‚Äôs deputy chief of staff, has been directing U.S. strikes on alleged Venezuelan drug boats via his Homeland Security Council, sidelining Marco Rubio and the NSC.
item_why_it_matters: Miller‚Äôs control highlights how Trump has centralized war-making in loyalists under shaky legal cover, bypassing normal oversight. The strikes risk sparking regional conflict while normalizing unilateral executive use of military force without Congress or allies.
title: Stephen Miller takes leading role in strikes on alleged Venezuelan drug boats

item_what_happened: Ukrainian specialists joined Danish forces for ‚ÄúWings of Defense,‚Äù a weeklong counter-drone exercise prompted by recent unidentified drone incursions over Denmark, including airports and military sites. Kyiv‚Äôs combat-tested drone expertise is central to the training.
item_why_it_matters: The drills deepen Ukraine-Denmark defense ties while directly responding to Russia-linked aerial threats on NATO‚Äôs northern flank. With Europe facing escalating drone warfare, Ukraine‚Äôs battlefield experience is a critical asset for allied security.
title: Ukrainian specialists join Danish forces for counter-drone drills amid airspace violations
authors: Lucy Pakhnyuk, Kateryna Hodunova, The Kyiv Independent, News Editor

item_what_happened: At the Warsaw Security Forum, Ukrainian President Zelenskyy called for a joint air defense shield with Poland and other allies to counter Russian drones and missiles. Ukraine will train Polish troops on drone countermeasures, while Romania pursues joint drone production with Kyiv under EU funding.
item_why_it_matters: The plan highlights Ukraine‚Äôs frontline expertise as NATO scrambles to respond to Russian airspace incursions in Poland and the Baltics. But Germany warns a full ‚Äúdrone wall‚Äù could take years, underscoring both Europe‚Äôs urgency and its lagging defense capacity against escalating Russian threats.
title: reuters.com

item_what_happened: Moldova‚Äôs ruling Party of Action and Solidarity (PAS) won 50.1% of the vote, defeating pro-Russian blocs and securing about 55 of 101 seats in parliament. Authorities reported massive Russian cyberattacks, vote-buying, and disinformation operations aimed at swaying the election.
item_why_it_matters: The result is a decisive victory for Moldova‚Äôs EU path and a blow to Moscow‚Äôs efforts to pull the country back into its orbit. With a majority, PAS can push reforms and EU accession plans, though Russia‚Äôs hybrid warfare will continue.
title: Moldova's pro-EU party wins clear parliamentary majority, defeating pro-Russian groups

item_what_happened: Trump‚Äôs sweeping tariffs are squeezing small businesses that lack the cash reserves and supply chain flexibility of larger corporations. Owners from Denver to Chicago report slashed profit margins, layoffs, and desperate cost-cutting as import duties on goods from China, Europe, and Latin America drive up expenses they can‚Äôt fully pass to customers.
item_why_it_matters: While Trump boasts of punishing foreign rivals, his tariffs are crushing America‚Äôs economic backbone‚Äîsmall businesses that employ millions. Many now face bankruptcy or layoffs, deepening economic inequality and exposing how Trump‚Äôs trade wars hit ordinary entrepreneurs hardest.
title: nytimes.com

item_what_happened: China, once the top buyer of U.S. soybeans at $12.6 billion last year, hasn‚Äôt purchased any since May after retaliatory tariffs from Trump‚Äôs trade war. Instead, it bought over a million tons from Argentina, aided by Trump‚Äôs $20 billion bailout, leaving U.S. exports down 23% and farmers with oversupply and shrinking storage.
item_why_it_matters: Trump‚Äôs tariffs wiped out America‚Äôs top farm export market, driving China to Argentina while U.S. farmers drown in unsold crops. As the Midwest faces financial ruin, Trump is betraying U.S. farmers at home even as he bails out Argentina‚Äôs economy abroad.
title: nytimes.com

item_what_happened: Trump vowed to slap a 100% tariff on all foreign-made movies and ‚Äúsubstantial‚Äù tariffs on imported furniture, claiming the moves would revive U.S. industries. The plans, announced on social media without details, follow last week‚Äôs new levies on upholstered furniture and cabinets.
item_why_it_matters: The threats add chaos to Trump‚Äôs already erratic trade regime, unsettling businesses while offering little clarity on enforcement. A movie tariff in particular would be nearly impossible to implement, underscoring Trump‚Äôs use of trade policy as political theater.
title: Are you a robot?

item_what_happened: Wall Street‚Äôs 2025 stock surge has set repeated records, fueled by rate cuts, strong earnings, and Trump‚Äôs corporate tax breaks. But analysts warn the rally looks frothy, with speculative trading in meme stocks, a SPAC revival, and AI giants dominating the S&P 500 at record valuations.
item_why_it_matters: A correction looms as Trump‚Äôs tariffs threaten to reignite inflation, undercutting the Fed‚Äôs rate cuts. With gold and silver spiking as hedges and transport stocks slumping, investors see mounting signs the rally could be on borrowed time.
title: wsj.com

item_what_happened: A federal judge temporarily halted Trump‚Äôs attempt to purge 532 jobs at the U.S. Agency for Global Media, which oversees Voice of America. Judge Royce Lamberth slammed officials for ‚Äúconcerning disrespect‚Äù toward the court, noting the layoffs were pushed hours after government lawyers claimed they were only a possibility.
title: Judge suspends Trump administration‚Äôs plan to eliminate hundreds of Voice of America jobs
